parameters.formDescription: Research trading YouTube videos related to a topic and get suggestions for a video

parameters.text:
=You will receive grouped keyword analysis data for YouTube topics.  
The **system prompt** already defines the schema, rules, and formatting requirements.  
This user prompt is lean — it simply injects the data and reminds you of the task.

---

## Prompt

Here is the grouped keyword data:

```json
{{ $('Code1').item.json }}
```

Using the system rules, generate up to **5 recommendations** strictly following the schema defined in the system prompt.  

- Always return a **single valid JSON array** (no markdown, no extra text).  
- Maximum of 5 items.  
- Each item must follow the schema defined in the system prompt.

options.systemMessage:
You are a senior YouTube content strategist.  
Input: an array of keyword groups with fields like `keyword`, `groupStats`, `winner`, `contenders`, `recommend`, `keywordFit`.  
Output: up to **5** production-ready recommendations optimized for discovery, click-through, retention, and execution speed.

---

## Objectives (in order)
1) Pick topics with the highest likelihood of **traffic + retention** based on provided metrics.  
2) Package them for **SEO + CTR** (tight titles, powerful thumbnail hooks).  
3) Provide **filmable outlines** with chapters and copy-paste assets (commands, common errors, links placeholders).  
4) Make the output **Airtable-friendly JSON**, strictly matching the schema.

---

## Decision Heuristics (apply to each keyword group)
Score candidate topics using:
- **Demand/Momentum**: higher `viewsPerDay` (VPD) among winner/contenders → stronger.  
- **Recency**: higher `recencyScore` and recent `publishedAt` → fresher opportunity.  
- **Engagement Gap**: high `erScore` but low VPD → underserved; good target.  
- **Coverage Gap**: same winner across multiple keywords → room to beat with better packaging/English/clarity.  
- **Keyword Fit**: higher `keywordFit.rankScore` and `keywordFit.quickScore` → better search intent.  
- **Duration Fit**: align with `groupStats.medianDurationSeconds`:  
  - ≤ 240s → Quick Start; 8–12 min if breadth needed; 12–20 min for deep+troubleshooting.  
- **Channel Authority**: if winners are low-authority channels but rank well → underserved niche (good).  
Combine into an internal **priorityScore** (0–100). Prefer topics with: strong intent, freshness, visible gaps, and executable differentiators (Docker, Coolify, macOS/Windows variants, troubleshooting).

---

## Packaging Rules
- **Title**: ≤ 70 chars, includes strongest query term(s); promise an outcome/time; avoid brackets spam.  
- **Thumbnail text**: ≤ 4 words, punchy, no jargon, no quotes; different from title; conveys *result* or *speed*.  
- **Chapters**: 7–10, each with a clear action/outcome; include **Troubleshooting** and **FAQ/Links** near the end.  
- **Assets** (in outline): provide code blocks (shell/PowerShell/docker compose), env samples, and a list of common errors + fixes.  
- **Angle**: match recommended `format` and `angle` but refine if data suggests a better variant (OS-specific, Docker vs. Node, Reverse proxy/Coolify).  
- **Localize**: default to English; note if top winner is non-English (differentiator).

---

## Output Format (STRICT JSON ARRAY; max 5 items)
Each item MUST match this schema exactly:

```json
{
  "keyword": "string",
  "priorityScore": 0,
  "recommendedTitle": "string (<=70 chars)",
  "thumbnailIdea": "string (<=4 words)",
  "format": "one of: Quick Start (3–5m) | Complete Install (8–12m) | Deep Dive + Troubleshooting (12–20m)",
  "angle": "short phrase describing the specific angle",
  "outline": [
    { "chapter": "Intro (Hook)", "details": "what value in 10–15s; who it's for; outcome" },
    { "chapter": "Prereqs", "details": "OS, Docker/Node versions, homebrew, links placeholders" },
    { "chapter": "Step 1", "details": "…" },
    { "chapter": "Step 2", "details": "…" },
    { "chapter": "Step 3", "details": "…" },
    { "chapter": "Troubleshooting", "details": "3–6 common errors with fixes; include commands" },
    { "chapter": "FAQ & Links", "details": "FAQ bullets; links placeholders; next video CTA" }
  ],
  "assets": {
    "commands": [
      "code or command snippet 1",
      "code or command snippet 2"
    ],
    "envSample": "inline .env sample if relevant",
    "commonErrors": [
      { "error": "short name", "fix": "one-line fix; add command if relevant" }
    ]
  },
  "notes": "why this should win; what to emphasize; differentiation vs. top results"
}
```

**Rules:**
- Always return an **array** (even if only 1 item).  
- **No markdown**, no trailing commas, no comments in JSON.  
- Escape newlines inside strings with `\\n`.  
- `priorityScore` is an integer 0–100 you compute from the heuristics (higher = better).  
- If multiple groups map to the same video angle, merge into one rec with the **best title** and mention overlapping keywords in `notes`.

---

## Outline Templates (use/adapt as needed)
- **Quick Start (3–5m)**: Hook → Prereqs → 3 Steps to working instance → Verify → Troubleshooting (1–2 fast fixes) → CTA.  
- **Complete Install (8–12m)**: Hook → Prereqs → Docker Compose (or Node) setup → Env & Volumes → Reverse Proxy (optional) → Verify → Troubleshooting (3–4) → FAQ & Links.  
- **Deep Dive + Troubleshooting (12–20m)**: Hook → Path A (Docker) → Path B (Node) → Reverse Proxy + SSL → Auth & Backups → Performance Tips → Troubleshooting (5–8) → FAQ & Links.

---

## Content Guardrails
- Prefer **Docker Compose** for local installs; include **Coolify** reverse proxy if angle says so.  
- Include **OS variants** when useful (macOS Apple Silicon, Windows/WSL, Linux).  
- Avoid vague steps (“configure stuff”); show exact commands/filenames.  
- Don’t invent versions; use placeholders like `<VERSION>` where unknown.  
- If winners are non-English or long/rambling, emphasize **clarity, speed, English voiceover** as differentiation.

---

## Example (style only; not prescriptive)
```json
[
  {
    "keyword": "n8n local install",
    "priorityScore": 87,
    "recommendedTitle": "Install n8n Locally with Docker (Mac/Windows) in 10 Minutes",
    "thumbnailIdea": "Up in 10",
    "format": "Complete Install (8–12m)",
    "angle": "Docker Compose + optional Coolify reverse proxy",
    "outline": [
      {"chapter":"Intro (Hook)","details":"Spin up n8n locally fast; Mac/Windows covered; copy-paste commands."},
      {"chapter":"Prereqs","details":"Docker Desktop; Docker Compose; optional Coolify; links."},
      {"chapter":"Step 1","details":"Create project folder; docker-compose.yml; volumes."},
      {"chapter":"Step 2","details":"ENV: N8N_HOST, PORT, WEBHOOK_URL; sample .env."},
      {"chapter":"Step 3","details":"docker compose up -d; access UI; create first workflow."},
      {"chapter":"Reverse Proxy (Optional)","details":"Coolify quick setup; domain, SSL."},
      {"chapter":"Troubleshooting","details":"Port in use; permissions; env not loaded; container restart loop."},
      {"chapter":"FAQ & Links","details":"Where to store credentials; backups; docs; next video CTA."}
    ],
    "assets":{
      "commands":[
        "mkdir n8n && cd n8n",
        "docker compose up -d",
        "docker compose logs -f n8n"
      ],
      "envSample":"N8N_PORT=5678\\nN8N_HOST=localhost\\nWEBHOOK_URL=http://localhost:5678/",
      "commonErrors":[
        {"error":"EACCES volume","fix":"Run with correct user or chmod target dir (demo command)."},
        {"error":"Port 5678 busy","fix":"Change N8N_PORT in .env and compose; restart."}
      ]
    },
    "notes":"Winner is non-English; opportunity for concise English guide with clear copy-paste setup."
  }
]
```

---

## If Input Is Empty or Low-Signal
Return **1** recommendation with a general but high-intent install angle and note the limitation in `notes`.

---

## Final Validation
- Ensure array length ≤ **5**.  
- Titles ≤ **70 chars**.  
- Thumbnail text ≤ **4 words**.  
- 7–10 chapters.  
- JSON parses without errors.

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
[
  {
    "keyword": "n8n local install",
    "priorityScore": 87,
    "recommendedTitle": "Install n8n Locally with Docker (Mac/Windows) in 10 Minutes",
    "thumbnailIdea": "Up in 10",
    "format": "Complete Install (8–12m)",
    "angle": "Docker Compose + optional Coolify reverse proxy",
    "outline": [
      { "chapter": "Intro (Hook)", "details": "Why local n8n; what you’ll get in 10 min; who it’s for." },
      { "chapter": "Prereqs", "details": "Docker Desktop; Docker Compose; optional Coolify; links placeholders." },
      { "chapter": "Step 1", "details": "Create project folder; add docker-compose.yml; bind volumes." },
      { "chapter": "Step 2", "details": "Create .env with N8N_PORT, N8N_HOST, WEBHOOK_URL; explain each." },
      { "chapter": "Step 3", "details": "docker compose up -d; verify at http://localhost:<port>." },
      { "chapter": "Reverse Proxy (Optional)", "details": "Coolify quick setup; domain and SSL; basic security tips." },
      { "chapter": "Troubleshooting", "details": "Ports in use; .env not loaded; container restart loop; permissions." },
      { "chapter": "FAQ & Links", "details": "Backups; credential storage; docs; next video CTA." }
    ],
    "assets": {
      "commands": [
        "mkdir n8n && cd n8n",
        "docker compose up -d",
        "docker compose logs -f n8n"
      ],
      "envSample": "N8N_PORT=5678\\nN8N_HOST=localhost\\nWEBHOOK_URL=http://localhost:5678/",
      "commonErrors": [
        { "error": "Port 5678 busy", "fix": "Change N8N_PORT in .env and compose; restart containers." },
        { "error": "EACCES on volume", "fix": "Ensure proper permissions or run with correct user mapping." }
      ]
    },
    "notes": "Winner video is non-English; ship concise English guide with copy-paste assets and better chapters."
  },
  {
    "keyword": "n8n docker",
    "priorityScore": 82,
    "recommendedTitle": "Run n8n with Docker Compose (Production-Ready Basics)",
    "thumbnailIdea": "Compose Fast",
    "format": "Deep Dive + Troubleshooting (12–20m)",
    "angle": "Compose file + volumes + env + healthchecks",
    "outline": [
      { "chapter": "Intro (Hook)", "details": "Stable local n8n in minutes; production-minded defaults." },
      { "chapter": "Prereqs", "details": "Docker, Compose, folder layout; links placeholders." },
      { "chapter": "Step 1", "details": "Write docker-compose.yml with n8n + Postgres; explain services." },
      { "chapter": "Step 2", "details": "Bind volumes; persistence strategy; basic backups." },
      { "chapter": "Step 3", "details": "ENV vars (N8N_HOST, WEBHOOK_URL, EXECUTIONS_MODE); when to change." },
      { "chapter": "Healthchecks", "details": "Add healthcheck to n8n + db; restart policies." },
      { "chapter": "Troubleshooting", "details": "DB connection errors; migrations; container restarts; network issues." },
      { "chapter": "FAQ & Links", "details": "Where to store secrets; scaling; docs; next steps (reverse proxy)." }
    ],
    "assets": {
      "commands": [
        "docker compose up -d",
        "docker compose ps",
        "docker compose logs -f n8n"
      ],
      "envSample": "DB_TYPE=postgresdb\\nDB_POSTGRESDB_HOST=db\\nDB_POSTGRESDB_DATABASE=n8n\\nDB_POSTGRESDB_USER=n8n\\nDB_POSTGRESDB_PASSWORD=<PASSWORD>",
      "commonErrors": [
        { "error": "DB init fails", "fix": "Check DB_* envs; ensure db service is up; add depends_on." },
        { "error": "Webhook mismatch", "fix": "Set correct N8N_HOST/WEBHOOK_URL; restart stack." }
      ]
    },
    "notes": "Position as ‘production-ready basics’; differentiate with healthchecks and persistence best practices."
  }
]

I have been into digital entrepreneurship since 2014 (Yes, you heard that right) and started making a consistent income in 2016. I run a bunch of blogs that make 6 figure income every month!

Here, in this channel, I document my journey and learnings to help you push the limits and make a living from the Internet.

I cover videos on entrepreneurship, business, AI, productivity, freelancing, digital nomadism and more.

snippet.title: Create a Pro Website
snippet.description:
🎯 Ready to build a website for your business, blog, or portfolio? You're in the right place.

On this channel, we create easy-to-follow tutorials that teach you how to build stunning websites—without writing a single line of code. Whether you're launching a personal brand, starting a business, or creating websites for clients to earn income, we’ve got you covered.

💡 What you’ll learn here:
✅ How to build websites using beginner-friendly tools like WordPress
✅ Step-by-step guides for business, blog, and portfolio sites
✅ Tips on making money with your website

I also break down exactly how people are turning simple websites into real income—and how you can too.

Subscribe for more tutorials, tips, and inspiration to help you launch your website and grow online.

snippet.title: SW Automation
snippet.description:
Hi, we’re Sil & Stef, and we’re passionate about helping people learn how to leverage AI & automation to save time, work smarter, and scale without limits.

As the founders of SW Automation, we’ve built a thriving community and educational platform that makes AI and automation accessible, from your first simple automation to advanced AI agents. We believe that powerful AI tools should be within reach for everyone, no matter your technical background.

Through SW Automation+, our membership program, we guide beginners, entrepreneurs, and freelancers in building automation systems that:

→ Cut costs
→ Eliminate repetitive work
→ Integrate seamlessly with multiple software products
→ Increase productivity and efficiency
→ Unlock new revenue streams without increasing headcount

Our greatest satisfaction comes from seeing members free up hours of their weeks, improve their lives, and create new opportunities using the systems we help them create.

Get in touch: info@swautomation.io

snippet.title: The A.I. Coders
snippet.description:
The A.I. Coders: Code your future.

Tech wizards and coding alchemists, welcome! Forget channels, The A.I. Coders is a portal where lines of code forge a digital utopia. We crack open the latest tech like treasure chests, revealing the secrets of AI, machine learning, blockchain, and beyond.

Newbie or Jedi Master? We've got your back (and keyboard). Dive into beginner-friendly tutorials that turn Python, Java, and JavaScript into child's play.

Coding's not just about semicolons, it's about magic. We smash tech jargon walls, transforming complex concepts into bite-sized knowledge nuggets. Imagine AI as your bestie – that's The A.I. Coders' power.

But you're not alone in this code cave. Join our vibrant community of tech enthusiasts where questions get answered, ideas spark, and projects come alive. We're all about collaboration, support, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

Share, Subscribe and Like to get Empowered with A.I.

snippet.title: GenAI Unplugged
snippet.description:
AI Automation for Everyone 🚀

Welcome to GenAI Unplugged, your go-to hub for AI-driven automation! Learn to build intelligent, no-code workflows using n8n, Zapier, Make.com, Relevance AI, Airtable, and more—without coding.

snippet.title: How To Tutor
snippet.description:
Welcome to How To Tutor — your shortcut to mastering tech, apps, and everything in between.
We create fast, step-by-step tutorials that help you solve real problems using the apps, tools, and platforms you use every day.

Whether you're trying to set up a crypto wallet, customize your Instagram, use a new SaaS platform, or simply fix a tech issue — we’ve got you covered.

🔍 What You'll Learn:
• App walkthroughs (Instagram, YouTube, WhatsApp, Snapchat etc)
• Crypto & Web3 tools (MetaMask, Phantom, Coinbase etc)
• SaaS & business tools (Canva, Zoom, Notion, Wix etc)
• Fixes, how-tos, and digital hacks for everyday users

🚀 Why Subscribe?
• Fast, beginner-friendly tutorials
• No fluff — just clear, actionable steps
• Fresh uploads every day
• Always updated for the latest tech in 2025

💡 Your digital life made easier. Start learning smarter — with How To Tutor.
